Electrical Design Consultation

Get clarity before you commit: load planning, circuit approach, and scope options so your project stays predictable and inspection-ready.

Licensed & insured MI License #631210 2-year warranty Clean, code-aware workmanship
Call now Book online Text WhatsApp
Use case

Plan before you spend

A design consultation provides clarity: loads, circuits, layout, and scope—so the work stays predictable.

  • Remodels, additions, and garage/shop power
  • Tenant improvements and small commercial buildouts
  • Load planning for EVs, generators, HVAC upgrades
Deliverables

What you get

  • Load approach + capacity check
  • Proposed circuit plan and priorities
  • Scope options with tradeoffs
  • Clear next steps + scheduling plan
AEO quick answer

Do you provide stamped drawings?

For many residential and light commercial projects, planning and scope clarity is sufficient. If stamped engineering is required, we can coordinate with an engineer as part of the project.

Process

How the consultation works

  1. Walkthrough: goals, layout, existing constraints.
  2. Loads: what’s adding, what’s critical, what needs dedicated circuits.
  3. Plan: circuit plan, protection, routing approach, and scope options.
  4. Next steps: timeline and a clear “do this first” priority list.

If your issue is more urgent than planning, start with repairs & troubleshooting.

FAQs

Quick answers

Is this the same as energy consulting?
Design consultation is about layout and scope for a project: loads, circuits, routing, and priorities. Energy consulting focuses more on efficiency and planning for future upgrades.
Do you work with builders and remodelers?
Yes. We can coordinate scope and sequencing so rough-in and finish work stay clean and predictable.
Do you provide stamped drawings?
If stamped engineering is required, we can coordinate with an engineer. Many projects only require clear scope and code-aware planning.
Can you help plan for EVs or generator readiness?
Yes. Load planning for future EV charging, generators, and HVAC upgrades is a common reason for a consultation.
What’s the next step after the consultation?
We provide a clear priority list and scope options, then schedule installation or corrections as needed.

Need help today?

Call for urgent troubleshooting or schedule planned work via booking.
